info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:44PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT AND NORTHEASTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 544 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Portales to 6 miles northwest of Crossroads. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portales, Dora, Causey, Milnesand, Lingo, Arch, Pep and Rogers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent dangerous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern and east central New Mexico.
